I can't tell by the screens included in the description... is this better than the TNT TS? The TNT TS was actually one of the best TS I've ever seen; that doesn't mean it was great, but it was definitely quite good for a TS. It was rather dark throughout, though. How does this rip compare to the TNT TS?

Also, @soccerbuff, if you use Windows, definitely get PeerBlock - I've never gotten any notifications from my ISP and I've downloaded over 1TB of data over 1508 torrents. Always keep your lists updated and you shouldn't have any problems; for example, my PeerBlock is currently blocking over one billion IP addresses, and a large amount of those are P2P addresses.

I currently have a torrent uploading with a ratio of 665.798, and I haven't heard anything about that, either.

It does not matter if you use peerblock! I was getting a letter and email like once a week. Then i started using a different isp and they never send letters or emails. @buddahass:  if you are a reader, and if you have a vivid imagination. I would suggest you sit down and read the first Harry Potter book. Do not judge the tale based on the 1st half of the last part of the story because you will be allowing yourself to miss out on a wonderful tale. If you have kids, then you definitely should give the book(s) a try. They are wonderful and easy stories to read to your kids, or have them read to you.

really. people just dont know what ISPs can do. for your info they monitor peer to peer traffic in the USA. when your IP is caught downloading a flagged torrent, they email the ISP who governs your IP. Then they are required by law to shut down service. after 3 valid infractions per 3 months, your service is suspended permenenty.
